snippet: Owners of three uninhabited islands in the East China Sea have made a verbal agreement to sell, according to a source close to the talks.
abstract: Japan strikes a tentative agreement to buy from private owners three uninhabited isles in the disputed Senkaku Islands chain in the East China Sea; deal would allow the government to nationalize three of the five major islands, but would not directly affect the more crucial issue of sovereignty over the islands, which are already administered by Japan but claimed by China and also Taiwan.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Owners of three uninhabited islands in the East China Sea have made a verbal agreement to sell, according to a source close to the talks.

headline.seo: Japan Said to Be in Tentative Deal to Buy Disputed Islands
headline.main: Japan Said to Have Tentative Deal to Buy 3 Disputed Islands From Private Owners
headline.print_headline: Japan Said to Have Tentative Deal to Buy 3 Disputed Islands From Private Owners
